title: E0658 should suggest `if Some(foo) == expr`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
The following output should have emitted a single error and suggested an equality check instead:

```
error[E0658]: destructuring assignments are unstable
   --> compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/wf.rs:287:35
    |
287 |         if Some(trait_ref.def_id) = tcx.lang_items().fn_once_trait() {
    |            ---------------------- ^
    |            |
    |            cannot assign to this expression
    |
    = note: see issue #71126 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/71126> for more information
    = help: add `#![feature(destructuring_assignment)]` to the crate attributes to enable

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/wf.rs:287:12
    |
287 |         if Some(trait_ref.def_id) = tcx.lang_items().fn_once_trait() {
    |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected `bool`, found `()`
```
